label: Métron Records
description:
Meitei follows the ghostly beauty found on the sublime Kwaidan tape with a second album of minimalist and fragrant ambient scenery for Séance Centre’s outlet for Japanese music, Métron.

Doubling the label’s tally after 7FO’s ‘Moment’ 2LP, ‘Komachi’ yields a more serene angle to Meitei’s music in 12 instrumental parts rippling with fleeting melodies... more

release: Down On The Road By The Beach
title_full:
Steve Hiett

              —
              Down On The Road By The Beach
            
              (Be With Records / Efficient Space)
label: Be With Records / Efficient Space
description:
First ever re-issue of this 1983 classic full of near-ambient arrangements that float in a space between The Durutti Column, Steve Cropper and Ashra from Steve Hiett, the "master of recontextualization."

"For the first time since its inception 36 years ago, Steve Hiett’s elusive Down On The Road By The Beach is finally made available outside of Japan. Most recognized... more

label: Hinge Finger
description:
Joy Orbison nimbly bridges London club sounds in a strong new refinement and loosening of his style for Hinge Finger, the label he runs with TTT’s Will Bankhead.

Bringing members of his home city’s jazz and soul scene, Mansur Brown and Keyah Blu, to a series of warped house, trip hop and experimental cuts alongside NYC’s Infinite, Joy O pointedly makes a... more

Laraaji meets ’log(m) in a super breezy and dub-sprung collaboration for Glasgow’s Invisible, Inc. Fire up the incense and make yourself comfortable, this one’s for the easy chair kru!

title_full:
Loraine James

label: Hyperdub
description:
Curveball debut from North London’s Loraine James on Hyperdub, injecting garage soul and playfullness into late ‘90s/early ‘00s style glitch electronica. Imagine Klein jamming with SND and Laurel Halo.
